headline: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: CVS, Spotify, Harley-Davidson, Coca-Cola, TSMC, BP, Datadog, S&P Global, and More
summary: Spotify Technology  rose 8.1% after the audio-streaming giant posted better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings and said its monthly active users rose 11% from a year earlier to 751 million, higher than the company’s prior guidance.  The healthcare company reported fourth-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street expectations and reiterated its 2026 guidance for adjusted earnings of between $7 and $7.20 a share.  Coca-Cola  fell 4.1% after fourth-quarter revenue growth in the beverage giant’s fourth quarter was slower than expected.

The healthcare company reported fourth-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street expectations and reiterated its 2026 guidance for adjusted earnings of between $7 and $7.20 a share.  Coca-Cola  fell 4.1% after fourth-quarter revenue growth in the beverage giant’s fourth quarter was slower than expected.

headline: Datadog’s stock jumps as Q4 earnings beat expectations
summary: Investing.com -- Datadog, Inc. (NASDAQ:DDOG) reported fourth quarter earnings that exceeded analyst expectations, sending shares soaring 7.9% premarket as investors cheered the cloud monitoring company's strong performance and positive revenue outlook.

content.title: Datadog’s stock jumps as Q4 earnings beat expectations
content.summary: Investing.com -- Datadog, Inc. (NASDAQ:DDOG) reported fourth quarter earnings that exceeded analyst expectations, sending shares soaring 7.9% premarket as investors cheered the cloud monitoring company's strong performance and positive revenue outlook.

headline: Datadog Stock Surges After Earnings. Software Gets Some Rare Good News.
summary: Shares of  Datadog  surged Tuesday after the software company breezed past quarterly earnings and revenue expectations.  Datadog  posted adjusted earnings of 59 cents a share for the fourth quarter, surpassing Wall Street’s call for 55 cents, according to FactSet.  Datadog stock jumped 9.7% in premarket trading.

content.title: Datadog Stock Surges After Earnings. Software Gets Some Rare Good News.
content.summary: Shares of  Datadog  surged Tuesday after the software company breezed past quarterly earnings and revenue expectations.  Datadog  posted adjusted earnings of 59 cents a share for the fourth quarter, surpassing Wall Street’s call for 55 cents, according to FactSet.  Datadog stock jumped 9.7% in premarket trading.

headline: Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025, Stock Soars
summary: Cloud monitoring platform Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 29.2% year on year to $953.2 million. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was optimistic at $956 million at the midpoint, 2.3% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.59 per share was 6.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025, Stock Soars
content.summary: Cloud monitoring platform Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 29.2% year on year to $953.2 million. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was optimistic at $956 million at the midpoint, 2.3% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.59 per share was 6.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Datadog: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the New York-based company said it had profit of 13 cents. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 59 cents per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

content.title: Datadog: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: On a per-share basis, the New York-based company said it had profit of 13 cents. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 59 cents per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

headline: 3 Stocks Estimated To Be Up To 49.8% Below Intrinsic Value
summary: As the United States stock market begins February on a high note with major indexes like the Dow Jones and S&P 500 showing significant gains, investors are keenly observing opportunities amidst fluctuating economic indicators and geopolitical developments. In this environment, identifying undervalued stocks becomes crucial as they may offer potential for growth when trading below their intrinsic value.

In this environment, identifying undervalued stocks becomes crucial as they may offer potential for growth when trading below their intrinsic value.

headline: Datadog (DDOG) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Good morning, and thank you for joining us to review Datadog's fourth quarter 2025 financial results, which we announced in our press release issued this morning.  Joining me on the call today are Olivier Pomel, Datadog's Co-Founder and CEO, and David Obstler, Datadog's CFO.  During this call, we will make forward-looking statements, including statements related to our future financial performance, our outlook for the first quarter and fiscal year 2026, and related notes and assumptions, our product capabilities, and our ability to capitalize on market opportunities.

content.title: Datadog (DDOG) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
content.summary: Good morning, and thank you for joining us to review Datadog's fourth quarter 2025 financial results, which we announced in our press release issued this morning.  Joining me on the call today are Olivier Pomel, Datadog's Co-Founder and CEO, and David Obstler, Datadog's CFO.  During this call, we will make forward-looking statements, including statements related to our future financial performance, our outlook for the first quarter and fiscal year 2026, and related notes and assumptions, our product capabilities, and our ability to capitalize on market opportunities.

headline: Datadog beats quarterly results estimates on AI-driven demand for cloud security
summary: Datadog beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, as rising adoption of artificial ​intelligence fueled stronger demand for its cloud security products, sending ‌its shares up 10% in premarket trading. The rise of generative AI has driven ‌greater data volume and complexity in corporate IT systems, increasing demand for application and infrastructure monitoring tools offered by firms such as Datadog. "During 2025, we delivered over 400 new features and capabilities ⁠to help our customers ‌as they migrate to the cloud and begin to deploy to production with next-gen AI," CEO Olivier ‍Pomel said.

content.title: Datadog beats quarterly results estimates on AI-driven demand for cloud security
content.summary: Datadog beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, as rising adoption of artificial ​intelligence fueled stronger demand for its cloud security products, sending ‌its shares up 10% in premarket trading. The rise of generative AI has driven ‌greater data volume and complexity in corporate IT systems, increasing demand for application and infrastructure monitoring tools offered by firms such as Datadog. "During 2025, we delivered over 400 new features and capabilities ⁠to help our customers ‌as they migrate to the cloud and begin to deploy to production with next-gen AI," CEO Olivier ‍Pomel said.

headline: Datadog beats quarterly estimates on AI-driven demand; shares rise
summary: Datadog beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, as rising adoption of artificial ​intelligence fueled stronger demand for its cloud security products, ‌sending its shares up more than 14%. The rise of generative AI has driven ‌greater data volume and complexity in corporate IT systems, increasing demand for application and infrastructure monitoring tools offered by firms such as Datadog. "During 2025, we delivered over 400 new features and capabilities to ⁠help our customers as ‌they migrate to the cloud and begin to deploy to production with next-gen AI," CEO Olivier ‍Pomel said.

The rise of generative AI has driven ‌greater data volume and complexity in corporate IT systems, increasing demand for application and infrastructure monitoring tools offered by firms such as Datadog. "During 2025, we delivered over 400 new features and capabilities to ⁠help our customers as ‌they migrate to the cloud and begin to deploy to production with next-gen AI," CEO Olivier ‍Pomel said.

headline: AI disruption fears create buying chance in US software stocks, strategists say
summary: The severity of the pullback in software stocks in recent days, driven by fears ​of advances in artificial intelligence disrupting the industry, has created opportunities for ‌investors to position for a rebound in higher-quality stocks, strategists at JP Morgan said.  "The market is ‌pricing in worst-case AI disruption scenarios that are unlikely to materialize over the next three to six months," JPMorgan strategists, led by Dubravko Lakos-Bujas, said in a note on Tuesday.  "Given the positioning flush, overly bearish outlook on AI disruption of ⁠software and solid fundamentals, we ‌believe the balance of risks is increasingly skewed towards a rebound, especially in higher quality software segments," the strategists wrote.

content.title: AI disruption fears create buying chance in US software stocks, strategists say
content.summary: The severity of the pullback in software stocks in recent days, driven by fears ​of advances in artificial intelligence disrupting the industry, has created opportunities for ‌investors to position for a rebound in higher-quality stocks, strategists at JP Morgan said.  "The market is ‌pricing in worst-case AI disruption scenarios that are unlikely to materialize over the next three to six months," JPMorgan strategists, led by Dubravko Lakos-Bujas, said in a note on Tuesday.  "Given the positioning flush, overly bearish outlook on AI disruption of ⁠software and solid fundamentals, we ‌believe the balance of risks is increasingly skewed towards a rebound, especially in higher quality software segments," the strategists wrote.

headline: February 2026's Noteworthy Stocks Estimated Below Intrinsic Value
summary: As February 2026 begins, U.S. stock markets have shown a strong start with major indices like the Dow Jones and S&P 500 ending sharply higher, reflecting investor optimism despite ongoing geopolitical and economic uncertainties. In this environment of fluctuating market dynamics and evolving trade agreements, identifying stocks that are potentially undervalued can offer investors opportunities to capitalize on discrepancies between market price and intrinsic value.

headline: Oil prices dip on Vitol's demand forecast, Datadog stock jumps
summary: Yahoo Finance Host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including crude oil (CL=F, BZ=F) taking a dip after Vitol anticipates demand to peak in the mid 2030s and Datadog (DDOG) stock popping after the cloud-based cybersecurity company released a better-than-expected forecast for its first quarter. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Software selloff 'biggest opportunity so far in 2026,' investor says
summary:
STORY: Global markets were rattled last week after AI developer Anthropic's launch of plug-ins for its Claude Cowork agent reignited fears that rapidly progressing AI systems could encroach on the core businesses of traditional software companies.

That led to the S&P 500 software and services index falling as much as 17% in six sessions through Thursday. The index has rebounded about 7% since Thursday.

"When we look at software, one of the key differentiators we believe between the potential winners and losers is the business model," Hegener explained. "Is it a per-seat subscription business model vis-a-vis Salesforce? Or is it more of a usage-based, computation usage-based business model?"

Among the latter is Datadog, which beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, sending its shares up more than 13%.

"We believe that that business is actually much better positioned now with the adoption of artificial intelligence versus a Salesforce, which could arguably be completely replaced by a few Claude bots," he said.
